oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: John T. Wilder corresondence with Martha Wilder, 1864 July 10
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Wilder, John Thomas, 1830-1917
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Letter from J. T. Wilder to his wife Martha asking for information about the construction of their new home in Greensburg, Indiana. He also informs Martha that General Thomas will not accept his resignation. Wilder also sends home pictures of Chattanooga's Lookout Mountain and 3 mockingbirds for his daughters, Mary and Anna. John also wonders why Martha has not responded to his question of whether or not she wants him to send along an African American domestic laborer.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: African American women -- Employment -- History -- 19th century; Mockingbirds; United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Health aspects
Forsyth, Riggs; Thomas, George H. (George Henry), 1816-1870; Wilder, Anna; Wilder, Mary
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: John T. Wilder correspondence with Martha Wilder, 1861-1865
